intro: Stenanthella frigida, commonly known as the cold mountain orchid, is a rare and delicate plant native to high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the orchid family (Orchidaceae) and is characterized by its small, pale green to white flowers. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is adapted to survive in harsh, mountainous climates. Its leaves are typically narrow and grass-like, and it produces a single flower per stem. Due to its specific habitat requirements, Stenanthella frigida is considered a vulnerable species.
